div1.p: This letter may come as a surprise to you for not hearing from us for so long. But it isn't from not thinking of you so often.

George has been in out of the hospital many times over a period, of time. This last five years he has been failing gradually has arterial scerosis (harding of the arteries). This past few months it has become exceedingly worse. He is very confused and very weak. My entire time has been devoted to him. I dress him shave him, & part of the time fed him as hsi hand shakes so. He is up & around. but sleep quite a little. I have time for little else, the reason I have not written sooner.

Last week I wrote to Marianna Ward Shilling in Bancroft to get
over
your address so I could drop you a line so you would know we (I)Geo+ I) wasere thinking about you.

When George was a little active mentally, he would say. "I wish I could see John!." But circumstance never permitedpermitted to arrange it. We never get to Lincoln before this. And here you were so close. It is ashamea shame.

George has always thought so much of you. And from what he has told me in the past, you paid a great part in his life. In fact you were his idol. and he never forgot it. Do
(2) 24
believe me.

He did mention you referedreferred to him in one of your early books. Would you write and tell ^me which one.? I was new in the family when, when many lovely things he said about you in regard to your writings has sort of left me. I do find many clippings which I have saved & he worshipedworshipped.
It is so sad to see a person as George, with such a beautiful outlook, wonderful disposition as he had ,& still has, declined so gradually.

I want you to know I tried to contact you when you spoke at Creighton Uni earlier in the year. I call radio station Creighton & several people, but
over
could not make any conne I thought it would keep George's spirit to know I talked to you.

This past week I saw in the paper where August 6th will be the 7th Neihardt Day at Bancroft. My how we wish we could be there! But it will be impossible. We also would like to go to Bancroft for the wedding of Marianna's daughter's wedding which is this coming Sat — July 29. It is Marianna's oldest daughter Becky being married. I can't realize her children are so big.

Our Jim is in Washington D. C he is prop. Mgr. in agriculture Bly. He is very busy. He has never married. Was engaged once But both felt there were not for each other I guess. Parted friends But
(3) 25
guess he is getting more particular and hasn't found the right one. He dates — but is not against women. He is very busy. He calls us on the phone every week. and trystries to get home twice a year. Especially at Xmas time. He has been a wonderful son. and never had a severe problem for us to worry over. which we are very grateful for. My only wish is — that he was a little closer. Especially now. I have no family. I have to do every thing now. Keep the house running, take care of any busyiness that arises. IAnd most of all with much Love — TAKE CARE OF HIM. The Lord has given me the strength as of mnow to do so, which I am most thankful for. I will keep ^him at home as long as I can handle him. It is getting harder all the time. He doesnt
over
want me out of his sight. guess he feels more secure when I am near.

He felt a great loss when Clarence passed a number of years ago with the accident he had. Then Clement passing. It left him a alonge family wise. Like me. But we have had a good marriage The past June 29th we were married 46 yr. George was 77yr—May 12.. When I read in the paper your age. 91 yr I couldn't believe it. It is so wonderful you can do all you are doing & able to get around.

You have some ardent admirers which one is my dear friend — She thingsk. your are wonderful & wants to know all about you. Her husband is retired ((Rex)) Col. in Army. & She a very brilliant woman, & enjoys your activities, books & everything about you.

She, — like we did; viewed the Dick Cavett's Show you were on. It was superb. I should have written you then but as I stated before my time & energy is ^so occupied I can do little else. Please forgive me for not writing sooner.
I know George retains many things part of the time & if you have time to write a line or so. it may revive his spirits to think you are thinking about him.
div1.closer:
My Very Best to you With Much Love From Both of Us
Ruth & George
George A. Ward
My address )
